alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:52PM EDT until August 04 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...NORTHWESTERN ANNE ARUNDEL...HOWARD... NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...SOUTHWESTERN BALTIMORE AND NORTHERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 552 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ellicott City, or near Columbia, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Elkridge, Damascus, Historic Ellicott City, Ellicott City, Catonsville, Woodlawn, Randallstown, Eldersburg, Milford Mill, Arbutus, Sykesville, Oakland, Savage-guilford, Scaggsville, Ilchester, Linthicum, Jessup, Savage and Fulton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
